Brief Hospital Course:
___ year old woman with hx of obesity, IDDM2, HTN, COPD ___ O2
at baseline), HFpEF, bipolar disorder, osteomyelitis of R foot
s/p ___ metatarsal amputation on ___ transferred from ___ 
for
further management of nonhealing amputation site. Admission to
medicine service for management of osteomyelitis was complicated
by respiratory failure. The patient briefly went to the ICU 
where she was put on BiPAP. After discharge from ICU, she 
received right heart catheterization which demonstrated elevated 
filling pressures. She was sent to the cardiology floor and 
diuresed until symptomatic relief. Hospital course was also 
complicated by AF for which she was started on metoprolol and 
warfarin. 

ACUTE/ACTIVE ISSUES:
====================
# Non-healing wound s/p ___ and ___ partial metatarsal resection
# Concern for ___
Transferred from ___ for multidisciplinary planning given
prolonged history with poor wound healing. Most likely due to
massive edema limiting wound healing. Cultures originally grew 
MRSA,
Enterobacter, GBS, and VRE. She received a debridement on ___. 
Blood cultures were trended until negative (most recent negative 
culture ___. Patient finished antibiotic course during 
admission. Patient was followed by podiatry for wound care and 
was given recommendations for home. 

#Acute decompensated Heart Failure
#HFpEF
Patient was found to be volume overloaded on admission for 
treatment of osteomyelitis. RHC demonstrated elevated filling 
pressures. She was diuresed with a Lasix drip and re cathed with 
some improvement in filling pressures and large symptomatic 
improvement. She was transitioned to oral diuretics prior to 
discharge. 

# Acute on chronic hypoxemic/hypercarbic respiratory failure
Multifactorial from acute on chronic COPD, chronic opiate use,
OSA, and HFpEF. Improved following solumedrol, biPAP, and IV
diuresis. Respiratory status greatly improved after aggressive 
diuresis and treatment for COPD exacerbation.

# ___ course was complicated by newly identified AF with RVR. 
She was started in metoprolol succinate 25 mg daily and 
warfarin. Pharmacy did not recommend a NOAC due to body habitus. 


# Chronic pain
Long history of narcotic use for chronic pain. Has had increased
somnolence with oxycodone in the past and may be contributing to
respiratory distress. Patient reporting breakthrough pain, but
concerns about somnolence. 

# Chronic anemia
Suspect ___ to CKD and anemia of chronic disease. Patient was 
asymptomatic with Hgb between ___ during admission.
